sen.j: 池田屋事件（いけだやじけん）は、江戸時代後期の元治元年6月5日 (旧暦)（1864年7月8日）に、京都三条通木屋町通（三条小橋）の旅館池田屋で京都守護職配下の治安維持組織である新撰組が、潜伏していた長州藩の尊皇攘夷派を襲撃した事件である。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, the Shinsen-gumi, a peace-keeping organization under the Kyoto protectorate, attacked the imperial loyalist faction from Choshu, which was hiding out in the Ikedaya inn at Kiyamachi (Sanjou-Kobashi Bridge) on Kyoto's Sanjou street, on June 5th (old calendar) of the 1st year of Genji, at the end of the Edo Period.
sen.cmt: “revere the emperor, expel foreigners” was a nationalist slogan, and is used as the name of the movement/faction here
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident, the Shinsen-gumi, a peace-keeping organization under the Kyoto protectorate, attacked the imperial loyalist faction from Choshu, which was hiding out in the Ikedaya inn at Kiyamachi (Sanjou-Kobashi Bridge) on Kyoto's Sanjou street, on July 8 in 1864, at the end of the Edo Period.

The Ikedaya Incident is the name given to an event that took place on July 8,1864 towards the end of the Edo Period in which the Shinsen-gumi, who was a peacekeeping organization under the Kyoto protectorate, attacked the imperial loyalist faction from Choshu who were hiding out at the Ikedaya Inn at Kiyamachi (Sanjou-Kobashi Bridge) on Sanjou-Street in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 池田屋騒動、 池田屋事変、三条小橋の変等ともいわれている。
sen.e: It is also known as the Ikedaya Rebellion, the Ikedaya Uprising, or the Sanjou-kobashi Disturbance.
It is also known as the Ikedaya Rebellion, the Ikedaya Uprising, or the Sanjou-kobashi Disturbance.
It is also known as the Ikedaya Rebellion, the Ikedaya Uprising, or the Sanjou-kobashi Disturbance.

sen.j: 近藤勇は書面で洛陽動乱と名づけている。
sen.e: In his writings Isamu KONDOU called it the Rakuyou Disturbance.
Isami KONDOU called it the Rakuyou Disturbance in his writings.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。勇の表記を修正。
sen.e: Isami KONDO called it the Rakuyo Upheaval in his writings.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 幕末の京都は政局の中心地となり、尊皇攘夷や勤皇等の思想を持つ諸藩の浪士が潜伏して活動していた。
sen.e: Kyoto at the end of the Edo period was at the center of politics, and Ronin from every faction who held such ideas as "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" and imperialists were operating in secret there.

Kyoto at the end of the Edo period was the center of politics, and Ronin from every faction who held such ideas as "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" and imperialists were operating in secret there.

Kyoto at the end of the Edo period was the center of political power struggles, and ronins (masterless samurai) from different feudal clans who held such ideas as "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" and imperialists were active behind the scenes.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 長州藩は会津藩と薩摩藩による宮中クーデターである八月十八日の政変で失脚し、朝廷では公武合体派が主流となっていた。
sen.e: The Choshu clan was overthrown by the Aizu and Satsuma clans in a coup on August 18th, and the Shogunate-Imperial faction became the mainstream in the imperial court.
The Choshu clan was overthrown by the Aizu and Satsuma clans in a coup on August 18th, and the Shogunate-Imperial faction became the mainstream in the imperial court.
The Choshu clan was overthrown by the Aizu and Satsuma clans in a coup on August 18th, and the Shogunate-Imperial faction became the mainstream in the imperial court.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 尊皇攘夷派は勢力挽回を試みており、京都守護職は新撰組を用いて市内の警備や探索を行わせる。
sen.e: The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction was trying to recover strength, and the Kyoto protectorate used the Shinsen-gumi for security and searches in the city.
The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction was trying to recover strength, and the Kyoto protectorate used the Shinsen-gumi for security and searches in the city.
The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction was trying to recover its strength, and the Kyoto protectorate used the Shinsen-gumi for security and searches in the city.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 五月下旬頃、諸士調役兼監察の山崎烝・島田魁らによって四条小橋上ル真町で炭薪商を経営する枡屋（古高俊太郎）の存在を突き止め、会津藩に報告。
sen.e: Around the end of May, moderators and observers including Susumu YAMAZAKI and Sakigake SHIMADA ascertained the presence of one Masuya (Shuntarou FURUTAKA) who was operating a charcoal business in Shinmachi at Shijou-kobashi.

Around the end of May, moderators and observers including Susumu YAMAZAKI and Sakigake SHIMADA ascertained the presence of Masuya store (Shuntarou FURUTAKA) that was operating a charcoal business in Shinmachi at Shijou-kobashi.

At around the end of May, moderators and observers including Susumu YAMAZAKI and Kai SHIMADA ascertained the presence of Masuya store (Shuntaro FURUTAKA) that was operating a charcoal business in Shijo-Kobashi-Agaru-Shin-cho, and made a report to the Aizu clan.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 武器や長州藩との書簡等が発見される。
sen.e: Weapons and communications with the Choshu clan were found.
Weapons and communications with the Choshu clan were found.
Weapons and communications with the Choshu clan were found.

sen.j: 古高を捕らえた新選組は、土方歳三の拷問により古高を自白させる。
sen.e: FURUTAKA's captors in the Shinsen-gumi coerced him into a confession by torturing Toshizou HIJITAKA.
FURUTAKA's captors in the Shinsen-gumi including Toshizou HIJIKATA tortured a confession from him.
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。土方の表記を修正。
sen.e: The Shinsen-gumi captors requested Toshizo HIJIKATA to torture FURUTAKA, who was coerced into a confession.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 計画は、祇園祭の前の風の強い日を狙って京都御所に火を放ち、その混乱に乗じて中川宮朝彦親王（後の久邇宮朝彦親王）を幽閉し、一橋慶喜（徳川慶喜）・会津の松平容保らを暗殺し、孝明天皇を長州へ連れ去るという物であった。
sen.e: The plan was to wait for a windy day before the Gion festival and set fire to the Kyoto Imperial Palace, and in the ensuing confusion arrest Prince Asahiko NAKAGAWAMIYA (who became Asahiko KUNINOMIYA), assassinate Yoshinobu IKKYO (Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA) and Katamori MATSUDAIRA of Aizu, and take Emperor Koumyou back to Choshu.

The plan was to wait for a windy day before the Gion festival and set fire to the Kyoto Imperial Palace, and in the ensuing confusion confine Prince Asahiko NAKAGAWANOMIYA (who became Asahiko KUNINOMIYA later), assassinate Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI (Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA) and Katamori MATSUDAIRA of Aizu clan, and take Emperor Koumyou to Choshu.
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。中川宮、一橋の表記を修正。
sen.e: The plan was to wait for a windy day before the Gion festival and set fire to the Kyoto Imperial Palace, and in the ensuing confusion confining Prince Asahiko NAKAGAWANOMIYA (who became Asahiko KUNINOMIYA later), assassinate Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI (Yoshinobu TUGAWA) and Katamori MATSUDAIRA of the Aizu clan, and take Emperor Koumyou to Choshu.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: さらに探索に於いて長州藩・土佐藩・肥後藩等の尊王派が古高逮捕をうけて襲撃計画の実行・中止について協議する会合が池田屋か四国屋に於いて行われる事を突き止める。
sen.e: Furthermore, the search discovered that royalists from the Choshu, Tosa, and Higo clans had heard about the arrest of FURUTAKA, and were to hold a meeting at Ikedaya or Shikokuya to discuss whether or not to go forward with the attack plan.

Furthermore, the search discovered that royalists from the Choshu, Tosa, and Higo clans were to hold a meeting at Ikedaya or Shikokuya to discuss whether or not to go forward with the attack plan, hearing about the arrest of FURUTAKA.

Furthermore, the search revealed that the loyalists from the Choshu, Tosa, and Higo clans were planning to hold a meeting at Ikedaya or Shikokuya to discuss whether or not to go forward with the plan of attack after hearing about the arrest of FURUTAKA.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 新選組は会津藩・桑名藩等に応援を要請するが、会津らの動きが遅く時刻になっても動かなかった。
sen.e: The Shinsen-gumi had asked for support from the Aizu and Kuwana clans, but the Aizu were too slow, and did not move when the time came.
The Shinsen-gumi had asked for support from the Aizu and Kuwana clans, but their actions were too slow, and they did not move when the time came.
The Shinsen-gumi had asked for support from the Aizu, Kuwana, and other clans, but their actions were too slow, and they did not move when the time came.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: このため事態は一刻を争うと見た局長の近藤勇は単独行動に踏み切り、近藤隊と土方隊の二手に分け捜索を開始する。
sen.e: That is why the boss, Isamu KONDOU, knowing that every moment counted, acted alone by splitting into two squads under KONDOU HIJIKATA squad and beginning the search.
That is why the boss, Isami KONDOU, knowing that every moment counted, acted alone by splitting their members into two squads under KONDOU and HIJIKATA and began the search.
That is why the boss, Isami KONDO, knowing that every moment counted, acted alone by splitting their members into two squads under KONDO and HIJIKATA and began the search.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 当時、新選組では病人が多い等の理由で人手が少なく、実際に捜索に当たったのは、近藤隊10人・土方隊24人の総数わずか34名だった（異説有り、出動隊士一覧を参照）。
sen.e: At the time, the Shinsen-gumi was short-handed because many members were sick; so a mere 34 members took part in the search - 10 in the Kondou squad and 24 in the Hijikata squad (accounts vary, cf. List of Soldiers Involved).

At the time, the Shinsen-gumi was short-handed because many members were sick; so only 34 members took part in the search - 10 in the KONDOU squad and 24 in the HIJIKATA squad. (There are different views on the number. cf. List of Soldiers Involved).
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。近藤、土方の表記を大文字に修正。
sen.e: At the time, the Shinsen-gumi was short-handed because many members were sick, so only 34 members took part in the search - 10 in the KONDO squad and 24 in the HIJIKATA squad (There are different views on the number. cf. List of Soldiers Involved).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 新選組は八坂神社から縄手通を土方隊、三条大橋を渡って木屋町通を近藤隊とし探索した。
sen.e: The Shinsen-gumi split up, the Hijikata squad searching Nawata Street from Yasaka Shrine, and the Kondou squad searching Kiyachou Street across the Sanjou Bridge.
The HIJIKATA squad, a part of the Shinsen-gumi, searched Nawate Street from Yasaka Shrine, and the KONDOU squad, Kiyamachi Street across the Sanjou Bridge.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。縄手通、木屋町通の表記を修正。近藤、土方の表記を大文字に修正。
sen.e: The HIJIKATA squad, a part of the Shinsen-gumi, searched Nawate Street from Yasaka Shrine, while the KONDO squad searched Kiyamachi Street across the Sanjo Bridge.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 捜索の末、近藤隊は池田屋で謀議中の尊攘過激派を発見した。
sen.e: At the end of the search, the Kondou squad was having a conference at Ikedaya when they were found by radical nationalists.
sen.cmt: The Japanese is an abbreviation of “radical 'revere the emperor, expel foreigners' faction”
sen.e: At the end of the search, the KONDOU squad found radical nationalists who were having a meeting at Ikedaya.
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映させるよう修正。
sen.e: At the end of the search, the KONDO squad found radical nationalists who were having a meeting at Ikedaya.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 近藤隊は数名で斬り込み、真夜中の戦闘となる。
sen.e: The Kondou squad was cut off with only a few people, and got into a battle in the middle of the night.
A few members of the KONDOU squad attacked them and got into a battle in the middle of the night.
A few members of the KONDO squad attacked them and got into a battle in the middle of the night.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 20数名の尊攘過激派に対し、当初踏み込んだのは近藤勇・沖田総司・永倉新八・藤堂平助の4名で、残りは屋外を固めた。
sen.e: Faced with 20-some radical nationalists, the first to step forward were Isamu KONDOU, Soushi OKITA, Shinpachi NAGAKURA, and Heisuke TOUDOU; while the rest shored up the perimeter.
Four members including Isami KONDOU, Soushi OKITA, Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Heisuke TOUDOU first attacked the 20-some radical nationalists while the other members waited outside.
Four of the members - Isami KONDO, Soji OKITA, Shinpachi NAGAKURA, and Heisuke TODO - first attacked the 20-some radical nationalists while the rest shored up the perimeter.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 裏口を守っていた安藤早太郎・奥沢栄助・新田革左衛門達のところに浪士が脱出しようと必死で斬りこみ逃亡。
sen.e: The ronin ran for their lives to escape the trap through the back door, which was guarded by Soutarou ANDOU, Eisuke OKUZAWA, and Kakusaemon NITTA.
A ronin frantically attacked Soutarou ANDOU, Eisuke OKUZAWA and Kakuzaemon NITTA who guarded the back door and succeeded to escape.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。革左衛門の表記を修正。
sen.e: Some ronins frantically attacked Hayatarou ANDO, Eisuke OKUZAWA and Kakuzaemon NITTA who guarded the back door, and succeeded to escape.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: これにより奥沢は死亡し、安藤・新田も一ヶ月後に死亡した。
sen.e: OKUZAWA died in the attack, and ANDOU and NITTA died a month later.
OKUZAWA died in the attack, and ANDOU and NITTA died a month later.
OKUZAWA died in the attack, and ANDO and NITTA died a month later.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 屋内に踏み込んだ沖田は奮戦したが、戦闘中に倒れて戦線離脱する。
sen.e: OKITA went inside the building and fought hard, but collapsed during the battle and was withdrawn from the battle.
OKITA went inside the building and fought hard, but collapsed during the battle and withdrew from it.
OKITA went inside the building and fought hard, but collapsed during the battle and withdrew from it.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: これには肺結核での喀血のためという説もあるが、様々な疑問点もあり確実ではない。
sen.e: Some accounts say that this was because of a tuberculosis-related lung hemorrhage, but there are some doubts and it is not certain.
There is a opinion that this was because he spit blood due to tuberculosis, but there are some doubts and it is not certain.
Some accounts say that this was because of a tuberculosis-related blood spitting, but there is a lot of doubt and it is not certain.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: また、一階の藤堂は汗で鉢金がずれたところに太刀を浴びせられ、額を斬られ戦線離脱した。
sen.e: Then TOUDOU, on the first floor, took a sword to the forehead when sweat caused his helmet to slip out of place, and he was withdrawn from the battle.
Then a sword hit the forehead of TOUDOU on the first floor when sweat caused his helmet to slip out of place, and he withdrew from the battle.
Then, a sword hit the forehead of TODO on the first floor when sweat caused his helmet to slip out of place, and he withdrew from the battle.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 一時は近藤・永倉の2人となるが、土方隊の到着により戦局は新選組に有利に傾き、9名討ち取り4名捕縛の戦果を上げる。
sen.e: Although they were down to just KONDOU and NAGAKURA at one point, the outcome was 9 kills and 4 arrests after the arrival of the Hijikata squad tilted the odds in favor of the Shinsen-gumi.

Although there were KONDOU and NAGAKURA only at one point, the arrival of the HIJIKATA squad tilted the odds in favor of the Shinsen-gumi and they achieved a result that they killed nine people and arrested four.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。土方を大文字に修正。
sen.e: Although there were KONDO and NAGAKURA only at one point, the arrival of the HIJIKATA squad tilted the odds in favor of the Shinsen-gumi and achieved a result of nine people killed and four arrested.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 会津・桑名藩の応援は戦闘後に到着した。
sen.e: Backup from the Aizu and Kuwana clans arrived after the battle.
Aizu and Kuwana clans arrived there to support them after the battle.
Aizu and Kuwana clans arrived there to support them after the battle.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 土方は手柄を横取りされぬように、一歩たりとも近づけさせなかったという。
sen.e: HIJIKATA would not let them anywhere near, to ensure that they could not take credit.
HIJIKATA would not let them anywhere near, to ensure that they could not take credit.
HIJIKATA would not let them anywhere near, to ensure that they could not take credit.

sen.j: この戦闘で数名の尊攘過激派は逃走したが、続く翌朝の市中掃討で会津・桑名藩らと連携し20余名を捕縛した。
sen.e: Although some of the radical nationalists escaped from the battle, more than 20 were arrested the following morning in a sweep of the city, with help from the Aizu and Kuwana clans.
Although some of the radical nationalists escaped from the battle, more than 20 people were arrested in the next morning by carrying out clearing operations with Aizu and Kuwana clans.
Although some of the radical nationalists escaped from the battle, the next morning more than 20 people were arrested by carrying out clearing operations with Aizu, Kuwana, and other clans.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: なお市中掃討では激戦となり、会津藩は5名、彦根藩は4名、桑名藩は2名の即死者を出した。
sen.e: The sweep of the city turned violent, and there were 5 deaths among the Aizu clan, 4 among the Hikone clan, and 2 among the Kuwana clan.
The sweep of the city turned violent, and there were five deaths among the Aizu clan, four among the Hikone clan, and two among the Kuwana clan.
The sweep of the city turned violent, and there were 5 immediate deaths among the Aizu clan, four among the Hikone clan, and two among the Kuwana clan.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 翌日の正午（夜のうちに帰ったのでは闇討ちの恐れがあるため夜が明けるまで休息をとっていた）、新選組は壬生村の屯所に帰還した。
sen.e: The next day at noon (returning home at night, they feared an ambush and rested until dawn) the Shinsen-gumi returned to a base in Mibu Village.
Next noon, the Shinsen-gumi returned to their base in Mibu Village. (If they returned home at night, they might fall into an ambush, so they took a rest in the city until dawn)

At noon of the following day, the Shinsen-gumi returned to their base in Mibu Village. (If they had returned to their base at night, they might have fallen into an ambush, so they took a rest in the city until dawn.)
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 沿道には見物人であふれていたという。
sen.e: It is said that the roadside was crowded with onlookers.
It is said that the roadside was crowded with onlookers.
It is said that the roadside was crowded with onlookers.

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 御所焼き討ちの計画を未然に防ぐ事に成功した新選組の名は天下に轟いた。
sen.e: The name of the Shinsen-gumi, which succeeded in preventing the burning of the imperial palace, became famous throughout the land.
The name of the Shinsen-gumi, which succeeded in preventing the burning of the imperial palace, became famous throughout the land.
The name of the Shinsen-gumi, which succeeded in preventing the plot to burn down the imperial palace, became famous throughout the land.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 逆に尊攘派は吉田稔麿・北添佶摩・宮部鼎蔵・大高又次郎・石川潤次郎・杉山松助・松田重助らの実力者が戦死し、大打撃を受ける（彼らは後の新政府により俗に「殉難七士」と呼ばれる）。
sen.e: The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction, on the other hand, took a big blow with the deaths of such important actors as Toshimaru YOSHIDA, Kichima KITAZOE, Teizou MIYABE, Matajirou OUTAKA, and Matsusuke SUGIYAMA (they were later called the 7 Martyrs by the new government).

The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction, on the other hand, took a big blow with the deaths of such important activists as Toshimaro YOSHIDA, Kichima KITAZOE, Teizou MIYABE, Matajirou OUTAKA, Junjiro ISHIKAWA, Matsusuke SUGIYAMA and Jusuke MATSUDA. (They were later called the seven Martyrs by the new government).
sen.cmt: 稔麿の表記を修正、石川潤次郎、松田重助を追加。
sen.e: The "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction, on the other hand, took a big blow with the deaths of such important activists as Toshimaro YOSHIDA, Kichima KITAZOE, Teizo MIYABE, Matajiro OTAKA, Junjiro ISHIKAWA, Matsusuke SUGIYAMA and Jusuke MATSUDA. (They were later called the "Seven Martyrs" by the new government.)
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 本来ならば桂小五郎（後の木戸孝允）もその場にいたはずだったが、到着が早すぎたので一度本拠地にもどり時間を待っている間に事件が起こってしまい難を逃れている。
sen.e: Kogorou KATSURA (later Takayoshi KIDO) should have been there too, but showed up early and went back to the base to wait a while, and was spared because the incident happened before he came back.
Kogorou KATSURA (later Takayoshi KIDO) should have been there too, but showed up early and went back to the base to wait a while, and was spared because the incident happened before he came back.

Kogoro KATSURA (later Takayoshi KIDO) should have been there too, but he arrived earlier and then went back to the base to wait a while. His life had been spared because the incident occurred before he came back.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: この事件をきっかけに、長州藩は強硬派に引きずられる形で挙兵・上洛し、7月19日 (旧暦)の禁門の変を引き起こす。
sen.e: Beginning with this incident the Choshu clan fell under the influence of zealots and later marched on the capital in the Hamaguri rebellion on 7/19 (old calendar).
Beginning with this incident, the Choshu clan fell under the influence of zealots and later came to Kyoto and raised the Hamaguri rebellion on July 19 (old calendar).
Beginning with this incident, the Choshu clan fell under the influence of zealots and later came to Kyoto and raised the Kinmon rebellion on July 19 (in the old calendar).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 池田屋事件により、明治維新が一年遅れたとも、尊攘派を刺激してしまい維新を早めてしまったともいわれる。
sen.e: It has been said both that the Ikedaya Incident delayed the Meiji Restoration by a year, and that it sped up the Restoration by giving a shot in the arm to the "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction.

It has been said that the Ikedaya Incident delayed the Meiji Restoration by a year. There is also another opinion that it sped up the Restoration by stirring up the "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction.

It has been said that the Ikedaya Incident delayed the Meiji Restoration by a year. There is also another opinion that it sped up the Restoration by stirring up the "revere the emperor, expel foreigners" faction.

sen.j: 作家の司馬遼太郎は、この事件がなかったら薩長土肥主力の明治維新は永遠にこなかったであろうと解釈している。
sen.e: Author Ryoutarou SHIBA's interpretation is that the Meiji Restoration led by the four clans would never have happened without this incident.
Author Ryoutarou SHIBA's interpretation is that the Meiji Restoration led by the four clans would never have happened without this incident.
Author Ryotaro SHIBA's interpretation is that the Meiji Restoration led by the four major clans of Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa, and Bizen would never have happened without this incident.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 池田屋事件に参戦した新選組隊士は以下の通り（諸説有り）
sen.e: The following Shinsen-gumi soldiers fought in the Ikedaya Incident (accounts vary).

sen.j: 松原隊（12名） - 諸説有り、井上隊とも、土方隊とも。

sen.j: なお、当時、所属していた馬詰信十郎・馬詰柳太郎・池原寛人は、この日に脱走した為に不参加。
sen.e: Nobujuurou UMAZUME, Ryuutarou UMAZUME, and Kanto IKEHARA, who were members at the time, fled on that day and did not participate.
Nobujuurou UMAZUME, Ryuutarou UMAZUME, and Kanto IKEHARA, who were members at the time, fled on that day and did not participate in the battle.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。信十郎、寛人の表記は確認できず。
sen.e: Shinjuro MAZUME, Ryutaro MAZUME, and Hiroto IKEHARA, who were members at the time, fled on that day and did not participate in the battle.
